articles.headline: Insured, but Bankrupted by Health Crises
articles.snippet: Some people counted as medically insured have coverage so meager that a medical crisis means financial calamity.
articles.abstract: Some people counted as medically insured have coverage so meager that a medical crisis means financial calamity.
articles.lead_paragraph: Health insurance is supposed to offer protection  both medically and financially. But as it turns out, an estimated three-quarters of people who are pushed into personal bankruptcy by medical problems actually had insurance when they got sick or were injured.

articles.headline: Roberts Court Shifts Right, Tipped by Kennedy
articles.snippet: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. emerged as a canny strategist at the Supreme Court this term.
articles.abstract: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. emerged as a canny strategist at the Supreme Court this term.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. emerged as a canny strategist at the Supreme Court this term, laying the groundwork for bold changes that could take the court to the right even as the recent elections moved the nation to the left.

articles.headline: Bank Woes Deepening in Europe
articles.snippet: When the financial crisis struck the global economy last autumn, European governments moved swiftly to keep their biggest banks from falling into an abyss — never mind fears over nationalization.
articles.abstract: When the financial crisis struck the global economy last autumn, European governments moved swiftly to keep their biggest banks from falling into an abyss — never mind fears over nationalization.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the financial crisis struck the global economy last autumn, European governments moved swiftly to keep their biggest banks from falling into an abyss  never mind fears over nationalization.

articles.headline: A Forecast With Hope Built In
articles.snippet: In forecasting unemployment, the president’s economists used the same models that had failed to predict the crisis.
articles.abstract: In forecasting unemployment, the president’s economists used the same models that had failed to predict the crisis.

articles.headline: Money Worries Kill A-List Film at Last Minute
articles.snippet: In a sign of growing caution in the industry, production was halted on a high-profile film starring Brad Pitt just days before shooting was to begin.
articles.abstract: In a sign of growing caution in the industry, production was halted on a high-profile film starring Brad Pitt just days before shooting was to begin.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  In a film production office here, at least a couple of employees were still hanging around on Monday, hoping in vain to score with their troubled baseball movie “Moneyball.”
